title: [CALCITE-2760] ElasticSearch adapter. Support sorting on unmapped fields (eg. _MAP['city'])
body:
Previously queries like below failed due to missing mapping between projections and items (as in `_MAP['foo']`):

```sql
select * from elastic order by _MAP['city']
select _MAP['city'] from elastic order by _MAP['state']
```

Reuse mapping from `ElasticsearchRel.Implementor.expressionItemMap` in `ElasticsearchSort` if
current elastic field name is unknown (like `EXPR$0`).

title: [CALCITE-2755] Expose document _id field when querying ElasticSearch
body:
[CALCITE-2755](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2755)

Allow user to query (project) [_id](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-id-field.html) field explicitly.

Note that (by default) meta fields are not available for `select *` type of queries and have to be explicitly listed in projection like `select _MAP['_id'], _MAP['a'] from elastic`.

Add additional mapping between calcite expression `EXPR$n` and item name `foo.bar` (as part of `_MAP['foo.bar']`). This information is otherwise lost during query translation.

Pls check that [saving mapping](https://github.com/apache/calcite/pull/982/files#diff-f24822f58a8062386da5287cd57cae65R75) between expression and item RexCalls is the right (recommended?)  approach.

title: [CALCITE-2751] Catch MetadataCycleException in VolcanoRelMetadataProvider
[CALCITE-2437] FilterMultiJoinMerge doesn't combine filters
body:
The FilterMultiJoinMergeRule class is intended to combine a filter on
top of a multi join into a single multijoin. But instead of combining
the post join filter with the filter's condition, it simply replaces
it.

Fixing the issue by composing a conjuction of the two filters and
adding it to the new multijoin.

title: [CALCITE-2743] Remove MySQL-specific Date & Time shifting
body:
A workaround for a legacy MySQL bug where Date/Time/Timestamp fields are being shifted against the UTC offset is being applied regardless of the backend store. This PR removes that code, since the can better be worked around using the MySQL "useLegacyDatetimeCode" connection parameter.

Fixes: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2743

title: [CALCITE-2717] Use Interner instead of LoadingCache to cache traits to allow GC
body:
Even though canonicalMap's value is soft referenced, key is strong referenced,
key and value are referencing the same object. So traits in the cache will
never be garbage-collected, which may cause OOM if we have tons of different
traits. This issue has been fixed by caching traits using Interner instead of
LoadingCache. In addition, canonizeComposite is removed, since canonize can do
the same work.

JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2717

title: [CALCITE-2703] Reduce code generation and class loading overhead when executing queries in the EnumerableConvention (Stamatis Zampetakis)
body:
1. Add a configurable Guava cache in EnumerableInterpretable#getBindable to re-use Bindable instances.
2. Avoid caching instances of classes with static fields.
3. Add JMH benchmark for the expensive part of EnumerableInterpretable#getBindable method.
4. Add utility method for obtaining integer runtime properties.
5. NPE in VisitorImpl when visiting a FieldDeclaration without an initializer.

title: [CALCITE-2689] ElasticSearch Adapter. Grouping on date / number fields fails.
body:
[CALCITE-2689](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2689)

For [Terms Aggregation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations-bucket-terms-aggregation.html) missing value has to have same type as group key.

Currently single (text) key is used `__MISSING__` which fails when grouping on non-string fields (eg. dates, numbers or booleans).

```sql
select max(amount), date from orders group by date -- date column is of type date (in ES)
```

When using `missing` (value) query converter should consider field type.

This logic should be reviewed once we migrate to [composite aggregations](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations-bucket-composite-aggregation.html) (available since [6.1](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.1/release-notes-6.1.0.html) see [PR-26800](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/26800)

title: [CALCITE-2705] Duplicated selectivity in metadata list
body: ![screen_shot_2018-11-26_at_6_57_48_pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1853780/49013514-fc5c0b80-f1b7-11e8-85f9-be491a22f8e9.jpg)

title: Can  you  tell me how to deal with keywords in SQL statement ?
body:
```
SELECT 
test1.COLA, test1.COLB, test1.COLC, test1.COLD, test2.distance, test2.times11, test2.mode, test2.onoff12, test2.mess
 FROM (
       SELECT 
          uploadTimeStamp(), COLA, COLB, COLC, COLD
       FROM ruleengine
       WHERE COLA > 5 
  ) AS test1
 JOIN (
        SELECTuploadTimeStamp(), distance, 'time' AS times11, mode, onoff AS onoff12, mess
 FROM ruleengine_300
 WHERE distance > 5
 ) AS test2 ON test1.COLB = test2.mess
```

`time` is keyword。if don‘t  wrap it by single quotes,  compile will throw err. But wrap it by   single quotes like this `time` ,There will also be problems。detail of problem:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16772932/49006832-ed1f9280-f1a4-11e8-8b63-2ba1a111bb3f.png)

the code:
```
ResultSet resultSet = sqlExecutor.executeQuery();
```

Could  anyone tell me how to get right result from `java.sql.ResultSet` ?

title: [CALCITE-2699]The bug of timestampadd handles time
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

*Fix the bug of `timestampadd` handles time*
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2699

## Brief change log

- *`DeduceType` method of `SqlTimestampAddFunction` will add the logic of time processing:*

  ```java
                          if (operandType2.getSqlTypeName().equals(SqlTypeName.TIME)) {
                              type = typeFactory.createSqlType(SqlTypeName.TIME);
                          } else {
                              type = typeFactory.createSqlType(SqlTypeName.TIMESTAMP);
                          }
  ```

## Verifying this change

*(Please pick either of the following options)*

This change is a trivial rework / code cleanup without any test coverage.

*(or)*

This change is already covered by existing tests, such as *(please describe tests)*.

*(or)*

This change added tests and can be verified as follows:

*(example:)*

- *Add time tests to `TIMESTAMPADD`*

## Documentation

- Does this pull request introduce a new feature? (yes / no)
- If yes, how is the feature documented? (not applicable / docs / JavaDocs / not documented)

title: [CALCITE-2684] AssertionError on RexBuilder when creating BigDecimal RexLiteral (Ruben Quesada Lopez)
body:
The method RexBuilder#makeExactLiteral(java.math.BigDecimal) throws an AssertionError if the BigDecimal parameter has an unscaled value that overflows long.
Moreover, with the current implementation, it can be possible to have this AssertionError, even in the cases when the variable l would not be used at all (decimal number).
Provided unit tests (the last one will fail with the current implementation).

[CALCITE-2677] Struct types with one field are not mapped correctly to Java Classes (Stamatis Zampetakis)
body:
1. Remove wrong unnesting of single field struct types from JavaTypeFactoryImpl and EnumUtils.
2. Refactor and move EnumUtils#javaRowClass method in PhysTypeImpl since it is used in only one place.
3. Add tests for JavaTypeFactoryImpl#getJavaClass and PhysType#fieldClass methods.
4. Modify EnumerableCollect to work always with rows represented as Object[], necessary for having MULTISET working after fixing CALCITE-2776.
5. Modify PhysType#convertTo to use JavaRowFormat instead of PhysType since the conversion is meant to only change the representation of rows in Java.
6. Disallow optimizations of the row format in the PhysType#convertTo method.
7. Implement SqlFunctions.slice method according to the specification in StdSqlOperatorTable.SLICE.
8. Add struct.iq test for reproducing CALCITE-2582 and CALCITE-2776.
9. Escape tests affected by CALCITE-2776.

title: support create and drop function statement like apache hive
body:
jira links https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2663

Flink uses the calcite SQL engine. CREATE FUNCTION statement Can help create SQL functions and user-defined functions, like apache hive . Create function statemen:
```sql
CREATE [OR REPLACE] FUNCTION [IF NOT EXISTS] [db_name.]function_name AS class_name
  [USING JAR|FILE|ARCHIVE 'file_uri' [, JAR|FILE|ARCHIVE 'file_uri'] ];

DROP FUNCTION [IF EXISTS] function_name;
```

  sample sql demo:
```sql
CREATE TABLE emp (
 id int,
 name varchar,
 birthday timestamp,
 other_info varchar
)

CREATE FUNCTION
    Date_Format AS 'org.apache.udf.DateFormat'
USING JAR 'file:/udf/udf-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar';

CREATE FUNCTION
    Get_Json_Object AS 'org.apache.udf.GetJsonObject'
USING JAR 'file:/udf/udf-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar';

SELECT
  count(id) as total_emp,
  Date_Format(birthday,'yyyy') as `year`,
  Get_Json_Object(Get_Json_Object(other_info,'address'),'province') as province
FROM emp
WHERE
  Date_Format(birthday,'yyyy') = '1990'
AND  
  Get_Json_Object(GetJsonObject(other_info,'address'),'province')
GROUP BY 
  `year`,
  province
;
```

title: [CALCITE-2651] Enable scrolling in ElasticSearch adapter
body:
The only efficient way to fetch full (large) result set in elastic is to use [scrolling](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-request-scroll.html).
Scrolling is to be used for all non-aggregate queries.

For more context [read discussion](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/ffb971f60ce8e0b0dbac4e1a5cbbf33017d97f69ca5f234fd7ca71ba@%3Cdev.calcite.apache.org%3E) on calcite dev list.

title: [CALCITE-2660] OsAdapterTest should check if required commands are available
support create function statement like apache hive
body:
jira links [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2663](url)

Flink uses the calcite SQL engine. CREATE FUNCTION statement Can help create SQL functions and user-defined functions ,create function statemen:
```sql 
CREATE [OR REPLACE] FUNCTION [IF NOT EXISTS] [db_name.]function_name AS class_name
  [USING JAR|FILE|ARCHIVE 'file_uri' [, JAR|FILE|ARCHIVE 'file_uri'] ];

DROP FUNCTION [IF EXISTS] function_name; 
```

example ：
```sql 
CREATE TABLE emp (
 id int,
 name varchar,
 birthday timestamp,
 other_info varchar
)

CREATE FUNCTION
    Date_Format AS 'org.apache.udf.DateFormat'
USING JAR 'hdfs://udf/udf-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar', JAR 'hdfs://flink/udf/customudf.jar';

CREATE FUNCTION
    Get_Json_Object AS 'org.apache.udf.GetJsonObject'
USING JAR 'hdfs://udf/udf-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar';

SELECT
  count(id) as total_emp,
  Date_Format(birthday,'yyyy') as `year`,
  Get_Json_Object(Get_Json_Object(other_info,'address'),'province') as province
FROM emp
WHERE
  Date_Format(birthday,'yyyy') = '1990'
AND  
  Get_Json_Object(Get_Json_Object(other_info,'address'),'province')
GROUP BY 
  `year`,
  province
;
```


title: [CALCITE-2652] SqlNode to SQL conversion fails if the join condition …
body:
…contains a boolean column reference

Previously when a join ON condition have contained an exact reference it ended up with an exception.

title: [CALCITE-2464] Allow to set nullability for columns of structured types (Ruben Quesada Lopez)
body:
RelRecordType nullable if all its fields are nullable.
Some unit tests' expected results needed to be updated after this modification.

title: Bug/calcite 2641
body:
This pull fixes bug https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2641 .

It adds conversion between Time/Date/Timestamp strings - internal calcite representation for some values into appropriate java classes when user defined table macro/function  is called.

title: [CALCITE-2631] + [CALCITE-2639]
[CALCITE-2638] Should not do constant reduction when RexInputRef is a call to a non-deterministic function

title: [CALCITE-2635] getMonotonocity is slow on wide tables
body:
Instead of getting the index of the column from rowType and then comparing
it to the collation field index, gets the collation field index and checks
if the corresponding rowType index matches.

labels.name: LGTM-will-merge-soon
labels.description: Overall PR looks OK. Only minor things left.

title: Eng 14621 volt db create table syntax support
body:
Full support of VoltDB CREATE TABLE syntax
    
I try to contain the changes for each VoltDB specific syntax differences, and make changes on VoltDB side when possible. Yet, the majority of changes still have to be on Calcite side. Details:
    
  * Support for VoltDB DDL syntax
     1. `CREATE TABLE(i VARCHAR(32 BYTES));` **BYTES** keyword
     2. `CREATE TABLE(i INT PRIMARY KEY, j INT UNIQUE);` Declaration of PKey / Unique with column declaration.
     3. `CREATE TABLE(..., UNIQUE (i + j));` **UNIQUE** expression of columns
     4. `CREATE TABLE(i TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(), ...);` or `CREATE TABLE(i TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW, ...)` -- Allow function expression to appear as default value
     5. `CREATE TABLE(i INT ASSUMEUNIQUE, ...);` and `CREATE TABLE(..., ASSUMEUNIQUE (i, j+k));` **ASSUMEUNIQUE**
 
 * Using TTL syntax on CREATE TABLE
 * Make `DEFAULT value` and `NOT NULL` order insensitive
 * Disabled test on *default expression* of CREATE TABLE
 * Added constraint syntax: `LIMIT PARTITION ROWS <number> EXECUTE (DELETE ? FROM tbl WHERE ...);`
 * Allow `UNIQUE`/`ASSUMEUNIQUE` to appear after `NOT NULL` (It is impossible (non-trivial) to allow form of `DEFAULT value UNIQUE/ASSUMEUNIQUE`, because DEFAULT's successor is an expression, and greedy matching guarantees that `DEFAULT 0 UNIQUE` is parsed so that `0 UNIQUE` is taken as DEFAULT expression, which should be a valid sub-query; thereby failing the parsing stage)

title: [CALCITE-2625] Window Frame Boundary Conditional printing based on Th…
body: …e aggregate function.

title: [CALCITE-2629] Remove call to CatalogReader#getAllSchemaObjects
body:
CatalogScope constructor makes a call to CatalogReader#getAllSchemaObjects
and stores its result into a private field which is not used by the
class itself, nor has some accessor other class could use.

Removing this call as it might be expensive on some systems.

title: [CALCITE-2617] FilterProjectTransposeRule should allow filter conditions with correlated variables to be pushed down (Stamatis Zampetakis)
body:
1. Add a new constructor accepting predicates for the filter and project operands.
2. Remove the correlating condition check from the body of the rule and make it an optional predicate.
3. Pass the new correlating condition predicate to the existing constructors (retaining the same functionality for the generic INSTANCE rule)

Note: Classes using the protected constructor may break if they rely in the fact that the filter is not pushed when it contains correlating conditions.

title: [CALCITE-1413] Enhance boolean case statement simplifications.
body:
Enables the simplification of case branch conditionals and values.
Adds a new case statement rewrite logic which could rewrite any case statement returning booleans
into and/or expressions.
